sense.name: a public official who adjudicates
sense.examples: The Supreme Court consists of nine judges. The plaintiff looked the judge right in the eye. Two field judges declared that the football was out of bounds. She has been a judge at several equestrian competitions. The line judge said the offense has no more time outs on the clock. The figure skater did a triple jump right in front of the judges.

sense.name: an expert or authority who critiques something
sense.examples: Who is the best judge of their own culture? John is a poor judge of character. She is an esteemed judge of 18th century miniature ceramic figures. When it comes to our products we let you be the judge.
